bugs.title: libksba: Unproportional amount of memory allocated when parsing crafted certificates

bugzilla.short_desc: libksba: Unproportional amount of memory allocated when parsing crafted certificates

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that an unproportionate amount of memory is allocated when parsing crafted certificates in libskba, which may lead to DoS. Moreover in libksba 1.3.4, allocated memory is uninitialized and could potentially contain sensitive data left in freed memory block.

Public via:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q3/343

Created libksba tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1369815]
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

blocked.short_desc: libksba: Unproportional amount of memory allocated when parsing crafted certificates

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that an unproportionate amount of memory is allocated when parsing crafted certificates in libskba, which may lead to DoS. Moreover in libksba 1.3.4, allocated memory is uninitialized and could potentially contain sensitive data left in freed memory block.

Public via:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q3/343

Created libksba tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1369815]
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
libksba-1.3.5-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.
